project_abstract.cdata: The Second Export Development Project's objectives are to ensure continuity of, and to promote further, activities supported under the first Export Development Project (EDP). Specifically, it involves: (i) increased productive capacity in the export-oriented manufacturing sector by strengthening the ability of the financial system to provide term loans for projects contributing to non-oil export development. It also entails (ii) support for the effective implementation of the ongoing policy and institution-building initiatives under the technical assistance component of the EDP. The project covers both direct and indirect exporters. In addition, the project provides the five state-owned commercial banks, two private banks and two non-bank financial institutions with long-term funds to support about 110 non-oil export-oriented investments.
